data.enText: slid
slid
move smoothly/quietly
to move easily over a smooth or wet surface; to make sth move in this way

data.chText: 我们从草坡上滑了下来。
data.enText: We slid down the grassy slope.
The drawers slide in and out easily.

data.chText: 她把手搭在栏杆上滑动着。
data.enText: She slid her hand along the rail.
The automatic doors slid open.
to move quickly and quietly, for example in order not to be noticed; to make sth move in this way

data.chText: 他不声不响地钻进被子。
data.enText: He slid into bed.

data.chText: 她趁着没人看见溜了出去。
data.enText: She slid out while no one was looking.

data.chText: 那人很快把钱塞进自己的口袋。
data.enText: The man slid the money quickly into his pocket.
become lower/worse
to become gradually lower or of less value

data.chText: 股价跌到了10年来的最低点。
data.enText: Shares slid to a 10-year low.

data.chText: 衰落（成）；逐渐陷入；逐渐衰退（到）
data.enText: to move gradually into a worse situation

data.chText: 这个行业已成衰退之势。
data.enText: The industry has slid into decline.
They were sliding towards bankruptcy.
He got depressed and began to let things slide (= failed to give things the attention they needed) .
becoming lower/worse
a change to a lower or worse condition
a downward slide in the price of oil
the team's slide down the table

data.chText: 旨在避免陷入内战的谈判
data.enText: talks to prevent a slide into civil war
The economy is on the slide (= getting worse) .
on ice

data.chText: （在冰上或光滑表面上）滑行，滑动
data.enText: a long, smooth movement on ice or a smooth surface
Her car went into a slide.
for children
a structure with a steep slope that children use for sliding down
to go down the slide
fall of rock
a sudden fall of a large amount of rock or earth down a hill

data.chText: 我当时担心会引起松散石块崩塌。
data.enText: I was afraid of starting a slide of loose stones.
photograph
a small piece of film held in a frame that can be shown on a screen when you shine a light through it

data.chText: 借助彩色幻灯片的讲话
data.enText: a talk with colour slides
a slide show/projector
for microscope
a small piece of glass that sth is placed on so that it can be looked at under a microscope
part of musical instrument

data.chText: （乐器上的）拉管，滑管，滑动装置
data.enText: a part of a musical instrument or other device that slides backwards and forwards
for hair

means: （乐器上的）拉管，滑管，滑动装置

ex.chText: 他看到一只鹰在头顶上翱翔。
ex.enText: He saw an eagle gliding high overhead.

synonyms.bx: 指顺畅且无声响地滑行，看似很轻松；也可指鸟儿或飞机滑翔。

ex.chText: 我的同桌滑冰滑得很好。

synonyms.bx: 指穿着冰鞋在冰上滑行。
指用滑雪板在雪地里滑行。

ex.enText: Boys like to slide over ice.
A truck slid into the ditch.

synonyms.bx: 多指在光滑的表面上迅速地连续滑动。

ex.zh: 开始滑动（或移动、陷入、下跌）
继续滑动（或移动、陷入、下跌）

tr: the act of moving smoothly along a surface while remaining in contact with it
example: his slide didn't stop until the bottom of the hill
the children lined up for a coast down the snowy slope

tr: sloping channel through which things can descend
a transparency mounted in a frame
a small flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study
plaything consisting of a sloping chute down which children can slide
(music) rapid sliding up or down the musical scale
example: the violinist was indulgent with his swoops and slides

tr: (geology) the descent of a large mass of earth or rocks or snow etc.
move obliquely or sideways, usually in an uncontrolled manner
example: the wheels skidded against the sidewalk

tr: to pass or move unobtrusively or smoothly
example: They slid through the wicket in the big gate
He slid the money over to the other gambler

value.def: When something slides somewhere or when you slide it there, it moves there smoothly over or against something.

example.ex: I slid the wallet into his pocket...
example.tran: 我把钱包麻利地塞进了他的口袋。

example.ex: Tears were sliding down his cheeks.
example.tran: 眼泪顺着他的脸颊往下淌。

value.def: If you slide somewhere, you move there smoothly and quietly.

example.ex: He slid into the driver's seat...
example.tran: 他麻利地坐进驾驶员的座位。

example.ex: 'Nice meeting you, Zoe,' I said and slid off.
example.tran: “很高兴见到你，佐薇，”说完我便溜走了。

value.tran: 麻利而无声地移动;悄悄地溜到

value.def: To slide into a particular mood, attitude, or situation means to gradually start to have that mood, attitude, or situation often without intending to.

example.ex: She had slid into a depression...
He needs them to stop the country sliding into chaos.
example.tran: 他需要他们来防止这个国家陷入混乱。

value.tran: 不自觉地陷入(某种情绪、态度或情境)

value.def: If currencies or prices slide, they gradually become worse or lower in value.

example.ex: The US dollar continued to slide...
The upset sent share prices sliding to their lowest level for almost 18 months...
example.tran: 这种不安情绪使股票价格跌落到几乎 18 个月以来的最低水平。

example.ex: Shares slid 11p to 293p after brokers downgraded their profit estimates...
example.tran: 股票经纪人降低了他们的利润预期之后，股价下跌了 11 便士至 293 便士。

example.ex: Its share slid from 24.24 per cent to 22.17 per cent.

value.def: A slide is a small piece of photographic film which you project onto a screen so that you can see the picture.
A slide is a piece of glass on which you put something that you want to examine through a microscope.
A slide is a piece of playground equipment that has a steep slope for children to go down for fun.
If you let something slide, you allow it to get into a worse state or condition by not attending to it.

example.ex: The company had let environmental standards slide.
example.tran: 这家公司听凭环境标准的不断下降。

value.tran: 放任…自流;任…恶化而不予处理

trans: 幻灯片形式；幻灯片显示；幻灯片展示；放幻灯；壁纸自动换
上滑音；向上滑动；上行滑弦；向上滑音；滑盖式
滑动石头；岩石滑动；崩岗；岩崩；岩滑
